revised_title: Glucose and Pyruvate Metabolism in Rat Retina
tldr: The authors studied the metabolism of glucose and pyruvate in rat retinas and found that under aerobic conditions, glucose was converted into lactate, carbon dioxide, and various amino acids. Under anaerobic conditions, glucose was mainly converted into lactic acid. The results showed similarities with glucose metabolism in the brain, with differences in lactate production and amino acid conversion rates.
